sen.j: 勝竜寺城（しょうりゅうじじょう）は、現在の京都府長岡京市に所在した、南北朝時代から江戸時代初期の城である。
sen.e: Shoryuji-jo Castle was a castle that existed in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture during periods from Nanbokucho to Edo.
Shoryuji-jo Castle was a castle that existed in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture between the Nanbokucho and Edo periods.
sen.cmt: I think periods need an article. 「during periods from Nanbokucho to Edo」→「between the Nanbokucho and Edo periods」
sen.e: Shoryuji-jo Castle was a castle that existed in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture between the the Northern and Southern Court and early Edo periods.
sen.cmt: early補足"Nanbokucho"→"the Northern and Southern Court"に変更しました。

sen.j: 城名は、付近の同名古刹に由来する。
sen.e: Its name comes from a nearby historic old temple of the same name Shoryu-ji.
Its name comes from an historic old temple nearby of the same name Shoryu-ji.
sen.cmt: Three adjectives modifying a noun sounds a little clumsy, so order changed.
sen.e: Its name comes from a historic old temple nearby of the same name Shoryu-ji.
sen.cmt: an→a

sen.j: 1339年(暦応2年)、京都をうかがう南朝方に対抗するため、北朝方の細川頼春が築いた城。
sen.e: In 1339, Yoriharu HOSOKAWA who was a Hokucho supporter built this castle to confront Nancho army that was aiming at Kyoto.
In 1339, Yoriharu HOSOKAWA who was a Hokucho supporter built this castle to confront the Nancho army that was moving towards Kyoto.
sen.cmt: I think Hokucho needs explaining.「the」挿入「aiming at」→「moving towards」
sen.e: In 1339, Yoriharu HOSOKAWA who was a Hokucho supporter built this castle to confront the Nancho army that was moving towards Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 西に西国街道、東に久我畷、南に淀川の水運をうかがう要地であるため、そののちも各勢力の争奪の舞台となる。
sen.e: Since the location was strategically very important with Saigoku Kaido on the west, Koganawate on the east, and the good transportation by Yodo-gawa River on the south, many military lords battled for the castle later in history.

Since the location was strategically very important, with Saigoku Kaido to the west, Koganawate to the east, and the good transportation provided by the Yodo-gawa River to the south, many military lords battled for the castle later in history.
sen.cmt: 「,」挿入「provided」挿入「the」挿入「on」→「to」
sen.e: Since the location was strategically very important, with Saigoku Kaido to the west, Koganawate to the east, and good transportation provided by the Yodo-gawa River to the south, many military lords battled for the castle later in history.
sen.cmt: “ and the good transportation ”=> “good transportation”

sen.j: 戦国時代には細川氏の細川元常、続いて三好氏重臣岩成友通が城主となる。
sen.e: In Sengoku Period (in the age of provincial wars), Mototsune HOSOKAWA of HOSOKAWA clan owned it, and later, Tomomichi IWANARI, a chief retainer of MIYOSHI clan, became its owner.
In Sengoku Period (the age of provincial wars), Mototsune HOSOKAWA of the HOSOKAWA clan held it, and later, Tomomichi IWANARI, a chief retainer of the MIYOSHI clan, became its owner.
sen.cmt: 「in」削除「the」挿入「owned」→「held」「the」挿入
sen.e: In the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), Mototsune HOSOKAWA of the HOSOKAWA clan held it, and later, Tomomichi IWANARI, a chief retainer of the MIYOSHI clan, became its owner.
sen.cmt: (the age of provincial wars)→ (Period of Warring States)”Sengoku Period”→"the Sengoku Period"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1571年(元亀2年)、山城国西岡一帯を織田信長より与えられ、城主となった細川幽斎(幽斎、元常の養子)は二重の堀を持つ堅固な城に改修。
sen.e: In 1571, Yusan HOSOKAWA (adopted son of Mototsune HOSOKAWA), who was given the land of Nishioka, Yamashiro no Kuni by Nobunaga ODA, became its owner, and renovated it into a formidable castle with double moats.

In 1571, Yusan HOSOKAWA (the adopted son of Mototsune HOSOKAWA), who was given land at Nishioka, Yamashiro no Kuni by Nobunaga ODA, became its owner, and renovated it into a formidable castle with a double moat.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入「the land of」→「land at」. Also moat changed to singular as this is a single system.
sen.e: In 1571, Yusai HOSOKAWA (the adopted son of Mototsune), who was given land at Nishioka in Yamashiro Province by Nobunaga ODA, became its owner, and renovated it into a formidable castle with a double moat.
sen.cmt: HOSOKAWA原文にないので削除no kuni→Provincein補足Yusan→Yusai

sen.j: 近年の発掘で多聞櫓などの遺構も確認されている。
sen.e: Recent excavations revealed some remains such as tamon-yagura.
Recent excavations have revealed some remains such as those of tamon-yagura.
sen.cmt: 「have」挿入「those of」挿入
sen.e: Recent excavations have revealed some remains such as those of tamon-yagura tower.
sen.cmt: 理解を助けるためtower補足

sen.j: 1582年(天正10年)、山崎の戦いでは、細川家の縁戚でもあった明智光秀の拠点となったが落城。
sen.e: In 1582, Mitsuhide AKECHI, a relative of HOSOKAWA family, made it his base for the Battle of Yamazaki, but eventually it fell.
In 1582, Mitsuhide AKECHI, a relative of the HOSOKAWA family, made it his base for the Battle of Yamazaki, but eventually it fell.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入
sen.e: In 1582, Mitsuhide AKECHI, a relative of the HOSOKAWA family, made it his base for the Battle of Yamazaki, but eventually it fell.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後、淀城の築城に石材が使用されるなどして荒廃する。
sen.e: Later, it was dilapidated after its rocks were used for building Yodo-jo Castle.
Later, it became dilapidated after its rocks were used for building Yodo-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 「was」→「became」
sen.e: Later, it became dilapidated after its rocks were used for building Yodo-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 江戸時代に入って1633年(寛永10年)、永井直清が封ぜられ（山城長岡藩）、修築をおこなうが、1649年(慶安2年)、摂津国高槻藩に転封されると同時に廃城となった。
sen.e: In 1633, Edo Period, Naokiyo NAGAI was assigned to this castle (Nagaoka han, Yamashiro no Kuni), and he did some renovation but it was deserted in 1649 when he was transferred again to Takatsuki han, Settsu no Kuni.

In 1633, in the Edo Period, Naokiyo NAGAI was assigned to this castle (Nagaoka han, Yamashiro no Kuni), and he did some renovation, but it was deserted in 1649 when he was transferred again to Takatsuki han, Settsu no Kuni.
sen.cmt: I think 'han' and 'kuni' need some explanation.「in the」挿入「,」挿入
sen.e: In 1633, in the Edo Period, Naokiyo NAGAI was assigned to this castle (domain of Nagaoka in Yamashiro Province), and he did some renovation, but it was deserted in 1649 when he was transferred again to the domain of Takatsuki in Settsu Province.
sen.cmt: Nagaoka han, Yamashiro no Kuni→domain of Nagaoka in Yamashiro ProvinceTakatsuki han, Settsu no Kuni→the domain of Takatsuki in Settsu Province

sen.j: 本丸および沼田丸趾が1992年(平成4年)に勝竜寺城公園として整備され、模擬櫓などが建造された。
sen.e: In 1992, remains of Honmaru and Numatamaru were refurbished into Shoryu-ji Castel Park, and simulated towers were built.
In 1992, the remains of Honmaru and Numatamaru were transformed into Shoryu-ji Castle Park, and towers were built in the style of the originals.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入「refurbished」→「transformed」「Castel」→「Castle」「simulated towers were built」→「towers were built in the styleof the originals」
sen.e: In 1992, the remains of Honmaru (the castle keep) and Numatamaru (Numata area) were transformed into Shoryu-ji Castle Park, and towers were built in the style of the originals.
sen.cmt: (the castle keep), (Numata area)補足

sen.j: 往時の遺構としては、当城北東に位置する神足神社境内に空堀や土塁が残る。
sen.e: A dry moat and mounds are remains from the original site at Kotari-jinja Shrine on the north-east of this castle.
The dry moat and earthworks remain from the original site at Kotari-jinja Shrine to the north-east of the castle.
sen.cmt: 「A」→「The」「mounds」→「earthworks」「on」→「to」「this」→「the」.The use of the word 'mound' without any explanation might be a little puzzling for the reader.
sen.e: The dry moat and earthworks remain from the original site at Kotari-jinja Shrine to the north-east of the castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
